sen.j: 土倉役（どそうやく）とは、倉役（くらやく）とも呼ばれ、中世において京都の土倉に対して行われた課税。
sen.e: Dosoyaku, also known as kurayaku, was a tax on doso (pawnbrokers and moneylenders) in Kyoto
Dosoyaku, also known as kurayaku, was a tax on doso (pawnbrokers and moneylenders) in Kyoto during the medieval era.
sen.cmt: added "during the medieval era" for "中世において"
sen.e: Dosoyaku, also known as kurayaku, was a tax on doso (pawnbrokers and moneylenders) in Kyoto during the medieval era.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 特に室町幕府財政において主要な財源の1つであった。
sen.e: It was the main source of revenue especially for the Muromachi bakufu (feudal government).
It was the main source of revenue, especially for the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: added comma; fixed description of "bakufu" to match the word list
sen.e: It was the main source of revenue, especially for the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 鎌倉時代から徴収が行われたと推定されている。
sen.e: It is assumed that collection of dosoyaku started in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It has been estimated that the collection of dosoyaku began during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: changed "assumed" to "estimated"; changed "started" to "began"
sen.e: It has been estimated that the collection of dosoyaku began during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 特に京都の土倉は延暦寺及びその傘下であった祇園社の支配を受けていたため、両者からの徴税を度々受けた他、朝廷からも臨時徴税を受けた。
sen.e: As the doso in Kyoto above all was under the control of Gion-sha Shrine which was affiliated with Enryaku-ji Temple, they were often taxed by the two and also subject to extraordinary taxation by the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Due to the fact that doso in Kyoto were under the control of Gion-sha Shrine, which was affiliated with Enryaku-ji Temple, they were often taxed by both and also subject to extraordinary taxation by the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: added comma after "Shrine"; changed "by the two" to "by both"
sen.e: Due to the fact that doso in Kyoto were under the control of Gion-sha Shrine, which was affiliated with Enryaku-ji Temple, they were often taxed by both and also subject to extraordinary taxation by the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その徴税の頻繁ぶりは建武式目では土倉の保護について1条を置いているほどであった。
sen.e: The taxation was so frequent that there was an article on protecting doso in the Kenmu code.
The taxation was so frequent that there was an article protecting doso in the Kenmu code.
sen.cmt: eliminated "on" before "protecting"
sen.e: The taxation was so frequent that there was an article protecting doso in the Kenmu code.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 室町幕府が京都の支配権を確立するにつれて朝廷の徴収代理から、財政基盤の弱かった幕府独自の土倉への課税を行うようになった。
sen.e: As the Muromachi bakufu was establishing authority in Kyoto, deputy collecting officials of the Imperial court took on the task of imposing independent tax on doso for the bakufu with a weak financial base, and in 1393 the bakufu issued 'Five rules regarding doso and sake shops scattered around Rakuchu' which was a five-article law.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As the Muromachi bakufu was establishing authority in Kyoto, deputy collecting officials of the Imperial court took on the task of imposing independent taxes on doso for the bakufu that had a weak financial base. In 1393 the bakufu issued 'Five rules regarding doso and sake shops scattered around Rakuchu' which was a five-article law.
sen.cmt: split into two sentences since one sentence was uncomfortably long; changed "with" to "that had" before "a weak financial base"
sen.e: As the Muromachi bakufu was establishing authority in Kyoto, deputy collecting officials of the Imperial court took on the task of imposing independent taxes on doso for the bakufu that had a weak financial base.

sen.e: In 1393 the bakufu issued 'Five rules regarding doso and sake shops scattered around Rakuchu' which was a five-article law.
sen.cmt: 同上

sen.j: これによって延暦寺などの有力権門の権益は否定され、朝廷などによる課税も最低限に制限された。
sen.e: The law denied the interests of the influential families including Enryaku-ji Temple, minimizing the taxation by the Imperial court and other parties.
The law denied the interests of influential families, including Enryaku-ji Temple, minimizing the taxation by the Imperial court and other parties.
sen.cmt: added comma after "families"
sen.e: The law denied the interests of influential families, including Enryaku-ji Temple, minimizing the taxation by the Imperial court and other parties.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 土倉役は土倉が抑えている質物の員数に応じて徴収されたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that dosoyaku was charged in accordance with the number of items held by doso.
It is believed that dosoyaku was charged in accordance with the number of items held by a doso.
sen.cmt: changed "considered" to "believed"; added "a" before "doso"
sen.e: It is believed that dosoyaku was charged in accordance with the number of items held by a doso.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その代わりに酒屋と土倉が年間6,000貫を幕府に納める代わりに原則的にはその他の課税を免除した。
sen.e: Sake shops and doso paid the bakufu 6,000 kan (obsolete unit of currency) per year and in return they were exempted from paying other taxes.
Sake shops and doso paid the bakufu 6,000 kan (now obsolete unit of currency) per year in return for being exempted from other taxes.
sen.cmt: added "now" before "obsolete"; eliminated "paying" as it was wordy and unecessary; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Sake shops and doso paid the bakufu 6,000 kan (now obsolete unit of currency) per year in return for being exempted from other taxes.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 当初は幕府が直接徴収していたものの、後には有力土倉を納銭方に任じて数十軒単位ごとに土倉役を徴収させた。
sen.e: At first, the bakufu directly collected dosoyaku but later appointed the influential doso as nosenkata (an institution to collect tax from moneylenders and sake breweries), having each nosenkata to collect dosoyaku from several dozens of doso, and eventually the process turned into a kind of subcontract system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The bakufu directly collected dosoyaku at first, but later on appointed influential doso as nosenkata (an institution to collect tax from moneylenders and sake breweries). Nosenkata would collect dosoyaku from several dozens of doso, and the process eventually turned into a kind of subcontract system.

sen.e: The bakufu directly collected dosoyaku at first, but later on appointed influential doso as nosenkata (an institution to collect tax from moneylenders and sake breweries) and had them collect dosoyaku from several dozens of doso.

sen.j: 更に特定の納銭方に土倉役や酒屋役などの収入を一時的に預けてそこから財政的な支出をさせるという公方御倉の指定も行われるようになった。
sen.e: Further, the bakufu designated Kubo-okura (financial branch) and entrusted the revenue including dosoyaku and Sakaya yaku (taxes imposed on sake brewery by Muromachi bakufu) with selected nosenkata.

sen.j: だが、土倉役を巡る延暦寺との対立は引き続き、その後も延暦寺などが勝手に徴収を行い、幕府が禁令を出すという事態の繰り返しが100年近く経た文明_(日本)年間にも繰り返されている。
sen.e: But the conflict over dosoyaku with Enryaku-ji Temple continued for nearly a hundred years, with Enryaku-ji Temple and others collecting dosoyaku at their discretion and the bakufu issuing the ban repeatedly.

A conflict over dosoyaku with the Enryaku-ji Temple continued for nearly a hundred years, however, with the temple and others collecting dosoyaku at their discretion and the bakufu issuing the ban repeatedly.
sen.cmt: changed "But" to "however" and used later in the sentence; changed "the" to "a" at the beginning of the sentence; fixed grammar
sen.e: A conflict over dosoyaku with the Enryaku-ji Temple continued for nearly a hundred years, and the state that Enryaku-ji Temple collected dosoyaku at their discretion and the bakufu issued the ban was occurred repeatedly even in Bunmei Era (1469-1487).
sen.cmt: 文意に合うように書き換えました。

sen.j: 更に土一揆によって徳政令が出された場合には、幕府は土倉役の徴収を停止しなければならず、幕府に欠く事の出来ない財政収入でありながら不安定さとも隣り合わせていた。
sen.e: When Tokuseirei (ordering return of land sold and dissolution of debts) was issued due to a peasants' uprising, the bakufu had to suspend the collection of dosoyaku, and therefore dosoyaku was an unstable revenue although it was indispensable for the bakufu.

When Tokuseirei (ordering return of land sold and dissolution of debts) was issued due to a peasant uprising, the bakufu had to suspend the collection of dosoyaku, making it an unstable form of revenue even though it was an indispensable form of income.

sen.e: When Tokuseirei (ordering return of land sold and dissolution of debts) was issued due to a peasant uprising, the bakufu had to suspend the collection of dosoyaku, making it an unstable form of revenue even though it was an indispensable form of income.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その収入額は明確ではないが、一説には当時の記録より嘉吉年間に月額200貫文が幕府に納付されていたと推定されている。
sen.e: The amount of revenue is unknown, but based on the record of that time, it is estimated that 200 kanmon was paid to the bakufu every month during the Kakitsu Era (1141-1144).
